---
status: draft
shortDescription: "Exception is the top-most exception class"
shortCorrection: "Throwable is the top-most exception class"
concepts:
  - Exception
  - Subtyping
related:
# - id: LiteralNoExpression
#   relation: Special case
inOtherPl:
# - pl: JavaScript
#   id: ExceptionRoot
# - pl: Python
#   id: ExceptionRoot
spec:
  - id: jls21
    sections: ["11.1.1"]
plVersion:
# from: jls8
# to: jls14
---

Class `java.lang.Exception` is the root of the exception class hierarchy. Thus, the `throw` statement must throw an object that is of type `Exception` or a subtype of `Exception`.

frontmatter.shortDescription: Exception is the top-most exception class
frontmatter.shortCorrection: Throwable is the top-most exception class
